00040 #ifndef _internalmotionstate_h_cpp
00041 #define _internalmotionstate_h_cpp
00042 
00043 // Keeps this file form being documented by doxygen
00044 /// @cond 0
00045 
00046 #include <Ogre.h>
00047 #include "btBulletDynamicsCommon.h"
00048 
00049 #include "vector3.h"
00050 #include "quaternion.h"
00051 
00052 namespace phys{
00053     namespace internal{
00054         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00055         /// @internal
00056         /// @class PhysMotionState
00057         /// @headerfile internalmotionstate.h.cpp
00058         /// @brief This class is used by the actor class to sync between the physics world and the graphical world.
00059         /// @details This class provides the link for position and orientation between the two worlds in the engine.
00060         /// This is called on every step(frame) of the world to sync the actor if it has moved.
00061         /// @attention This filename ends in .h.cpp which means it is a header and should not be compiled with the regular cpp files, just included by them, but it is also a
00062         /// source file and should not shipped with the DLL when the SDK is released. This is used for engine internals that need to be used by multiple classes.
00063         ///////////////////////////////////////
00064         class PhysMotionState : public btMotionState {
00065             private:
00066                 Ogre::SceneNode* snode;
00067                 btTransform worldtrans;
00068 
00069             public:
00070                 /// @internal
00071                 /// @brief Default Constructor.
00072                 /// @details Basic no-initialization constructor.
00073                 PhysMotionState();
00074 
00075                 /// @brief Constructor.
00076                 /// @details The class constructor.
00077                 /// @param scenenode The scenenode belonging to the actor.
00078                 PhysMotionState(Ogre::SceneNode* scenenode);
00079 
00080                 /// @brief Destructor.
00081                 /// @details The class destructor.
00082                 virtual ~PhysMotionState();
00083 
00084                 /// @brief Sets the scenenode.
00085                 /// @details Sets the scenenode to be sync'd every step.
00086                 /// @param scenenode The scenenode belonging to the actor.
00087                 void SetNode(Ogre::SceneNode* scenenode);
00088 
00089                 /// @brief Sets the initial position.
00090                 /// @details Sets the position the actor will be placed in when it is added to the world.
00091                 /// This function is called on by the ActorBase function SetInitPosition().
00092                 /// @param position The vector3 representing the location to be used.
00093                 void SetPosition(Vector3 position);
00094 
00095                 /// @brief Sets the initial orientation.
00096                 /// @details Sets the orientation the actor will have when it is added to the world.
00097                 /// This function is called on by the ActorBase function SetInitOrientation().
00098                 /// @param orientation The vector3 representing the orientation to be used.
00099                 void SetOrientation(Quaternion orientation);
00100 
00101                 /// @brief Sets the initial position.
00102                 /// @details This function is called on by the physics world upon adding the actor to the world.
00103                 /// This function uses the previous set vector3 that was set with SetInitPosition(). @n
00104                 /// Default position is (0,0,0).
00105                 /// @param worldTrans The location and orientation data.
00106                 virtual void getWorldTransform(btTransform &worldTrans) const;
00107 
00108                 /// @brief Updates the position and orientation.
00109                 /// @details This function is called each step(frame) by the physics world to sync the physics and graphical worlds.
00110                 /// @param worldTrans The location and orientation data.
00111                 virtual void setWorldTransform(const btTransform &worldTrans);
00112         };
00113     }// /internal
00114 }// /phys
00115 
00116 /// @endcond
00117 
00118 #endif
